New Records: Greece has now won four consecutive matches against Ireland since June 2023, with an aggregate score of 8-1.
Caoimhín Kelleher made an outstanding individual performance until a late error led to Greece's second goal.
Key Match Events: Caoimhín Kelleher's late error gifted Greece the clinching goal.
Ireland's attempt to equalize was turned down by the referee.
Pre-Game Insights: Heimir Hallgrímsson emphasized the importance of a 'warrior' mentality, referencing Aron Gunnarsson.
Robbie Brady's corner was disrupted by fans' lasers, prompting the referee to intervene.
Ireland adopted a 4-4-2, high-pressing formation with Troy Parrott and Evan Ferguson in attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Heimir Hallgrímsson expressed frustration with Ireland's performance, especially after the late error.
Ivan Jovanović praised Greece's resilience and ability to capitalize on Ireland's mistakes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was dedicated to the memory of George Baldock, an English-born defender who played for Greece.
Enes Unal's stunning free-kick attempt was notable but ultimately unsuccessful.
Others: Greece's victory marked their fourth consecutive win over Ireland since June 2023.
